snippet: The largest industrial company in the United States is moving away from the finance sector as it refines its focus.
abstract: General Electric reports second-quarter results, reflecting steady return to its industrial roots as giant conglomerate accelerates shift; total revenue across corporation rose 3 percent, to $36.2 billion, from $35.1 billion in year-earlier quarter; reports net income of $3.5 billion, up 13 percent.
lead_paragraph: The largest industrial company in the United States is moving away from the finance sector as it refines its focus.

headline.main: G.E. Results Reflect Shift Away From Finance Unit
headline.print_headline: G.E. Results Reflect Shift Away From Finance Unit
